tit.e: Nara-Kaido Road
Nara-kaido Road
tit.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
tit.e: Nara-kaido Road

sen.j: 奈良街道（ならかいどう）・大和街道（やまとかいどう）は奈良あるいは大和国に向かう街道の総称。
sen.e: Nara-Kaido Road and Yamato-Kaido Road are collective names of roads that lead to either Nara or Yamato Province.
Nara-kaido Road and Yamato-kaido Road are collective names of roads that lead to either Nara or Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Nara-kaido Road and Yamato-kaido Road are collective names of roads that lead to either Nara or Yamato Province.

sen.j: 歴史的理由からも地理的理由からも複数のルートが存在する。
sen.e: Multiple number of roads exist due to both historical and geographical reasons.
Multiple number of roads exist due to both historical and geographical reasons.
Multiple number of roads exist due to both historical and geographical reasons.

tit.j: 京都府内における奈良街道・大和街道
tit.e: Nara-Kaido and Yamato-Kaido roads in Kyoto Prefecture
Nara-kaido and Yamato-kaido roads in Kyoto Prefecture
tit.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
tit.e: Nara-kaido and Yamato-kaido roads in Kyoto Prefecture
Historical Changes
tit.cmt: Changesだけでは不足と思い、Historicalを加えました。
tit.e: Historical Changes
Historical Changes

sen.j: 原形は北陸道から平城京に向かう街道（逢坂関を越えてから山科盆地を南に下ったあと、淀川右岸を上り宇治市を経由して奈良へ）。
sen.e: The original route was the path from Hokuriku-do Road leading to Heijokyo (passing through Osaka-no-seki and leading south through Yamashina Basin, moving upstream on the right bank of Yodogawa River and reaching Nara via Uji City).

The original route was the path from Hokuriku-do Road leading to Heijokyo (passing through Osaka-no-seki and leading south through Yamashina Basin, moving upstream on the right bank of Yodo-gawa River and reaching Nara via Uji City).
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: The original route was the path from Hokuriku-do Road leading to Heijokyo (passing through Osaka-no-seki and leading south through Yamashina Basin, moving upstream on the right bank of Yodo-gawa River and reaching Nara via Uji City).

sen.j: 平安京遷都後も奈良へ向かう際は巨椋池を避け、深草大亀谷～六地蔵～宇治経由の道（現在の奈良線とほぼ並行）がとられた。
sen.e: After the capital was moved to Heian-kyo, the route to Nara went through Fukakusa Okamedani, Rokujizo and Uji, bypassing Ogura-ike Pond. (The road runs roughly parallel to the present-day JR Nara Line.)

After the capital was moved to Heian-kyo, the route to Nara went through Fukakusa Okamedani, Rokujizo and Uji, bypassing Ogura-ike Pond (the road runs roughly parallel to the present-day JR Nara Line).
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。Ｔhe 小文字にしました。
sen.e: After the capital was moved to Heian-kyo, the route to Nara went through Fukakusa Okamedani, Rokujizo and Uji, bypassing Ogura-ike Pond (the road runs roughly parallel to the present-day JR Nara Line).

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉の伏見城築城によって宇治川が改修され、伏見宿 (京街道)から対岸の向島 (京都府)に渡り、小倉堤上の道を抜ける街道が整備され、大和街道と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: With Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's construction of Fushimi Castle, Uji-gawa River underwent modifications. A road was built to connect Fushimi-juku (Kyo-Kaido Road) with Mukaijima on the other side of the river, crossing the river over Ogura-zutsumi bank. It was named Yamato-Kaido Road.

With Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's construction of Fushimi-jo Castle, Uji-gawa River underwent modifications: A road was built to connect Fushimi-juku (Kyo-kaido Road) with Mukojima (Kyoto Prefecture) on the other side of the river, crossing the river over Ogura-zutsumi bank and it was named Yamato-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: Fushimi-jo Castleに訂正しました。分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。kaido 小文字にしました。Mukojimaに訂正しました。(Kyoto Prefecture)補足しました。
sen.e: With Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's construction of Fushimi-jo Castle, Uji-gawa River underwent modifications: A road was built to connect Fushimi-juku (Kyo-kaido Road) with Mukojima (Kyoto Prefecture) on the other side of the river, crossing the river over Ogura-zutsumi bank and it was named Yamato-kaido Road.

sen.j: その後昭和初期に巨椋池が干拓され、観月橋から巨椋池の二の丸池であったところを国道が通され、京都と奈良の幹線道路の役割を担うようになった。
sen.e: In the early Showa Period, Ogura-ike Pond was reclaimed, with a national route built from Kangetsu-kyo Bridge and over what used to be Ninomaru-ike Pond at Ogura-ike. The road became a trunk route linking Kyoto and Nara cities.

In the early Showa period, Ogura-ike Pond was reclaimed, with a national route built from Kangetsu-kyo Bridge and over what used to be Ninomaru-ike Pond at Ogura-ike, and the road became a trunk route linking Kyoto and Nara cities.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: In the early Showa period, Ogura-ike Pond was reclaimed, with a national route built from Kangetsu-kyo Bridge and over what used to be Ninomaru-ike Pond at Ogura-ike, and the road became a trunk route linking Kyoto and Nara cities.

sen.j: 近年では、京都と奈良をつなぐ国道24号に奈良街道という愛称が付されている。
sen.e: In recent years, National Route 24 between Kyoto and Nara came to be known by its nickname, Nara-Kaido Road.
In recent years, National Route 24 between Kyoto and Nara came to be known by its nickname, Nara-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: In recent years, National Route 24 between Kyoto and Nara came to be known by its nickname, Nara-kaido Road.

tit.j: 「奈良街道」と「大和街道」の使われ方の違い
tit.e: Differences in the use of the names Nara-Kaido Road and Yamato-Kaido Road
Differences in the use of the names Nara-kaido Road and Yamato-kaido Road
tit.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
tit.e: Differences in the use of the names Nara-kaido Road and Yamato-kaido Road

sen.j: 奈良街道と大和街道は、いずれも奈良（大和国）に向かう街道を指す名称であるが、京都府内では、この「奈良街道」と「大和街道」は違いを持ちながら使われている。
sen.e: Nara-Kaido and Yamato-Kaido are both road names that refer to roads that lead to Nara (Yamato Province). In Kyoto Prefecture, however, the two names are used differently.
Nara-kaido and Yamato-kaido are both road names that refer to roads that lead to Nara (Yamato Province), however, the two names are used differently in Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: Nara-kaido and Yamato-kaido are both road names that refer to roads that lead to Nara (Yamato Province), however, the two names are used differently in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 明治時代の京都府令によると、京都から伏見街道（後に京都・伏見間の経路は竹田街道に変わる）を通り、伏見を経て、巨椋池の小倉堤上を通り、木津川 (京都府)を泉大橋で渡り大和国境に至る道を大和街道。
sen.e: According to an order of Kyoto Prefecture issued in the Meiji Period, the road starting from Kyoto and through Fushimi-Kaido Road (the road section from Kyoto and Fushimi later renamed Takeda-Kaido Road) to Fushimi and onward over Ogura-zutsumi Bank in Ogura-ike Pond, crossing Izumi-ohashi Bridge over Kizu-gawa River and reaching the boundary to Yamato Province is named Yamato-Kaido Road. The road that starts at Fukakusa, splitting away from Fushimi-Kaido Road, passing through Okamedani, Yashina-toge Pass and into Rokujizo, next running along Uji-gawa River's right bank into Uji, and merging with Yamato-Kaido Road at Okubo and splitting from the road at Tanagura-mura Village, Soura-gun Count (present-day Kizugawa City) to cross Kizu-gawa River, entering Soura Village and reaching the boundary with Yamato Province is named Kooriyama-Kaido Road.

According to an order of Kyoto Prefecture issued in the Meiji period, the road starting from Kyoto and through Fushimi-kaido Road (the road section from Kyoto and Fushimi later renamed Takeda-kaido Road) to Fushimi and onward over Ogura-zutsumi Bank in Ogura-ike Pond, crossing Izumi-ohashi Bridge over Kizu-gawa River and reaching the boundary to Yamato Province is named Yamato-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。kaido 小文字にしました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to an order of Kyoto Prefecture issued in the Meiji period, the road starting from Kyoto and through Fushimi-kaido Road (the road section from Kyoto and Fushimi later renamed Takeda-kaido Road) to Fushimi and onward over Ogura-zutsumi Bank in Ogura-ike Pond, crossing Izumi-ohashi Bridge over Kizu-gawa River and reaching the boundary to Yamato Province is named Yamato-kaido Road.

sen.j: 深草から伏見街道と分岐し、大亀谷を通り八科峠を越え六地蔵に至り、宇治川右岸を通り宇治を経て大久保で大和街道と合流、相楽郡棚倉村（現在の木津川市）で大和街道と分岐し木津川を渡り相楽村を経て大和国境に至る道を郡山街道としている。
sen.e: The road that starts at Fukakusa, splitting away from Fushimi-kaido Road, passing through Okamedani, Yashina-toge Pass and into Rokujizo, next running along Uji-gawa River's right bank into Uji, and merging with Yamato-kaido Road at Okubo and splitting from the road at Tanagura-mura Village, Soura-gun County (present-day Kizugawa City) to cross Kizu-gawa River, entering Soura Village and reaching the boundary with Yamato Province is named Kooriyama-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処kaido 小文字にしました。Countyに訂正しました。
sen.e: The road that starts at Fukakusa, splitting away from Fushimi-kaido Road, passing through Okamedani, Yashina-toge Pass and into Rokujizo, next running along Uji-gawa River's right bank into Uji, and merging with Yamato-kaido Road at Okubo and splitting from the road at Tanagura-mura Village, Soura-gun County (present-day Kizugawa City) to cross Kizu-gawa River, entering Soura Village and reaching the boundary with Yamato Province is named Kooriyama-kaido Road.

sen.j: 後に、東海道の髭茶屋追分から山科盆地を南下し六地蔵に至り、そこから宇治川右岸を通って伏見観月橋で大和街道と合流する道を奈良街道として加えている。
sen.e: The order also adds the road from Higechaya-oiwake on the Tokaido Road going south through Yamashina Basin, passing through Rokujizo, running along Uji-gawa River's right bank and merging with Yamato-Kaido Road at Fushimi Kangetsu-kyo Bridge as Nara-Kaido Road.

The order also adds the road from Higechaya-oiwake on the Tokaido Road going south through Yamashina Basin, passing through Rokujizo, running along Uji-gawa River's right bank and merging with Yamato-kaido Road at Fushimi Kangetsu-kyo Bridge as Nara-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: The order also adds the road from Higechaya-oiwake on the Tokaido Road going south through Yamashina Basin, passing through Rokujizo, running along Uji-gawa River's right bank and merging with Yamato-kaido Road at Fushimi Kangetsu-kyo Bridge as Nara-kaido Road.

sen.j: 現在では京都・奈良間の街道を指す汎称として「奈良街道」という呼称が用いられるが、小倉堤上に築かれたバイパス部分を指して言う場合は、かつての呼称からもっぱら「大和街道」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: At present, the name Nara-Kaido is used to refer collectively to roads between Kyoto and Nara. However, the historical name Yamato-Kaido Road is used for the bypass built over Ogura-zutsumi bank.
At present, the name 'Nara-kaido' is used to refer collectively to roads between Kyoto and Nara, however, the historical name 'Yamato-kaido Road' is used for the bypass built over Ogura-zutsumi bank.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: At present, the name 'Nara-kaido' is used to refer collectively to roads between Kyoto and Nara, however, the historical name 'Yamato-kaido Road' is used for the bypass built over Ogura-zutsumi bank.

sen.j: また、奈良街道という名称は京都と奈良をつなぐ幹線道路の愛称として現役の幹線道路にも用いられているが、大和街道は歴史的な旧道を示すものとしての認識が強い。
sen.e: The name Nara-Kaido Road is also used as the nickname for an existing arterial road connecting Kyoto and Nara. However, the name Yamato-Kaido is widely recognized to refer to the old historical road.
The name Nara-kaido Road is also used as the nickname for an existing arterial road connecting Kyoto and Nara, however, the name Yamato-kaido is widely recognized to refer to the old historical road.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: The name Nara-kaido Road is also used as the nickname for an existing arterial road connecting Kyoto and Nara, however, the name Yamato-kaido is widely recognized to refer to the old historical road.

sen.j: なお、京都中心部と奈良をつなぐ幹線道路である国道24号に対して、現在奈良街道という愛称が与えられているが、京都市内（京都・伏見間）では、奈良街道という名称はほとんど用いられない。
sen.e: National Route 24, an arterial road linking central Kyoto and Nara, has been given the nickname Nara-Kaido Road. However, this nickname is rarely used inside Kyoto City (road section between Kyoto and Fushimi).

National Route 24, an arterial road linking central Kyoto and Nara, has been given the nickname Nara-kaido Road, however, this nickname is rarely used inside Kyoto City (road section between Kyoto and Fushimi).
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: National Route 24, an arterial road linking central Kyoto and Nara, has been given the nickname Nara-kaido Road, however, this nickname is rarely used inside Kyoto City (road section between Kyoto and Fushimi).

sen.j: これはその経路にある伏見は、奈良方面だけでなくかつては大阪方面への陸路・水路の玄関口でもあったこと、また、現在の国道24号の経路は竹田街道という名称が根付いているためである。
sen.e: This is due to the fact that Fushimi, through which the road passes, does not only lead to Nara but serves also as the gateway for land and river transportation to the Osaka area, as well as the fact that the name Takeda-Kaido Road had already been established for the present-day National Route 24.

This is due to the fact that Fushimi, through which the road passes, does not only lead to Nara but serves also as the gateway for land and river transportation to the Osaka area, as well as the fact that the name Takeda-kaido Road had already been established for the present-day National Route 24.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: This is due to the fact that Fushimi, through which the road passes, does not only lead to Nara but serves also as the gateway for land and river transportation to the Osaka area, as well as the fact that the name Takeda-kaido Road had already been established for the present-day National Route 24.

sen.j: 京都市内には山科盆地内に奈良街道という愛称を持つ道路があり混同を避けるためともいえよう。
sen.e: Another reason may be to avoid confusion with another road in Kyoto City's Yamashina Basin, which is also known as Nara-Kaido Road.
Another reason may be to avoid confusion with another road in Kyoto City's Yamashina Basin, which is also known as Nara-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Another reason may be to avoid confusion with another road in Kyoto City's Yamashina Basin, which is also known as Nara-kaido Road.

tit.j: 奈良街道または大和街道と称される区間
tit.e: Road sections known as either Nara-Kaido Road or Yamato-Kaido Road
Road sections known as either Nara-kaido Road or Yamato-kaido Road
tit.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
tit.e: Road sections known as either Nara-kaido Road or Yamato-kaido Road

sen.j: 以下が京都府内で奈良街道・大和街道と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The following roads are called Nara-Kaido or Yamato-Kaido inside Kyoto City
The following roads are called Nara-kaido or Yamato-kaido inside Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: The following roads are called Nara-kaido or Yamato-kaido inside Kyoto City.

tit.j: 大和街道（小倉堤上の道）
tit.e: Yamato-Kaido Road (road crossing over Ogura-zutsumi Bank)
Yamato-kaido Road (road crossing over Ogura-zutsumi Bank)
tit.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
tit.e: Yamato-kaido Road (road crossing over Ogura-zutsumi Bank)

sen.j: 伏見から豊後橋（現在の観月橋）で宇治川を渡り、巨椋池（二の丸池と大池の間）に築かれた小倉堤の堤上を進み、西目川、槇島を経て、小倉からは直線的に南下して大久保で宇治からの道と合流し、奈良へと続く。
sen.e: Road starting at Fushimi, crossing Uji-gawa River at Bungo-bashi Bridge (present-day Kangetsu-kyo Bridge) and over Ogura-zutsumi Bank built in Ogura-ike Pond (between Ninomaru and Oike ponds), passing through Nishime-gawa River and Makishima, turning straight southward from Ogura, merging with another road from Uji at Okubo and leading into Nara.

Road starting at Fushimi, crossing Uji-gawa River at Bungo-bashi Bridge (present-day Kangetsu-kyo Bridge) and over Ogura-zutsumi Bank built in Ogura-ike Pond (between Ninomaru and Oike ponds), passing through Nishime-gawa River and Makishima, turning straight southward from Ogura, merging with another road from Uji at Okubo and leading into Nara.

Road starting at Fushimi, crossing Uji-gawa River at Bungo-bashi Bridge (present-day Kangetsu-kyo Bridge) and over Ogura-zutsumi Bank built in Ogura-ike Pond (between Ninomaru and Oike ponds), passing through Nishime-gawa River and Makishima, turning straight southward from Ogura, merging with another road from Uji at Okubo and leading into Nara.

sen.j: 明治時代には、京都から伏見街道（後に竹田街道）を経て伏見までの区間もあわせ、奈良県境までが大和街道と位置付けられた。
sen.e: In Meiji Period, the road section of Fushimi-Kaido Road (later renamed Takeda-Kaido Road) from Kyoto up to Fushimi was combined with the above as Yamato-Kaido Road up to the boundary with Nara Prefecture.

In Meiji period, the road section of Fushimi-kaido Road (later renamed Takeda-kaido Road) from Kyoto up to Fushimi was combined with the above as Yamato-kaido Road up to the boundary with Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: In Meiji period, the road section of Fushimi-kaido Road (later renamed Takeda-kaido Road) from Kyoto up to Fushimi was combined with the above as Yamato-kaido Road up to the boundary with Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 現在は、京都・奈良間をつなぐ街道として「奈良街道」、あるいは、京都・奈良間をつなぐかつての幹線道路として「旧奈良街道」と呼ばれることもあるが、観月橋から大久保までの区間は、江戸時代から明治時代に掛けての呼称である「大和街道」と言われることが多い。
sen.e: Today, it is called Nara-Kaido Road as the route connecting Kyoto and Nara or at times as "Old Nara-Kaido Road" for its historical importance as an arterial road between Kyoto and Nara. However, the section from Kangetsu-kyo Bridge to Okubo is very often called Yamato-Kaido Road, the name that had been used from Edo to Meiji periods.
sen.cmt: 旧奈良街道: Old Nara-Kaido Road
sen.e: Today, it is called 'Nara-kaido Road' as the route connecting Kyoto and Nara or at times as 'Old Nara-kaido Road' for its historical importance as an arterial road between Kyoto and Nara, however, the section from Kangetsu-kyo Bridge to Okubo is very often called 'Yamato-kaido Road,' the name that had been used from Edo to Meiji periods.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: Today, it is called 'Nara-kaido Road' as the route connecting Kyoto and Nara or at times as 'Old Nara-kaido Road' for its historical importance as an arterial road between Kyoto and Nara, however, the section from Kangetsu-kyo Bridge to Okubo is very often called 'Yamato-kaido Road,' the name that had been used from Edo to Meiji periods.

sen.j: 小倉堤は巨椋池干拓とその後の宅地開発に際し切り崩されたが、西目川や槇島で一部地盤が高くなっている部分が残されている。
sen.e: Ogura-zutsumi Bank had been demolished with Ogura-ike reclamation and subsequent housing development. However, parts of the bank remain partially in Nishinome-gawa and Makishima areas where elevation is relatively high.

Ogura-zutsumi Bank had been demolished with Ogura-ike reclamation and subsequent housing development, however, parts of the bank remain partially in Nishinome-gawa and Makishima areas where elevation is relatively high.
sen.cmt: 分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: Ogura-zutsumi Bank had been demolished with Ogura-ike reclamation and subsequent housing development, however, parts of the bank remain partially in Nishinome-gawa and Makishima areas where elevation is relatively high.

tit.j: 山科盆地内（髭茶屋追分から六地蔵）
tit.e: Inside Yamashina Basin (from Higechaya-oiwake to Rokujizo)
Inside Yamashina Basin (from Higechaya-oiwake to Rokujizo)
Inside Yamashina Basin (from Higechaya-oiwake to Rokujizo)

sen.j: 東海道の髭茶屋追分で三条大橋への道と分かれ南西へ進み、大宅、小野、醍醐を経て、六地蔵に達する。
sen.e: The road splits into two at Higechaya-oiwake on Tokaido Road, with one heading to Sanjo-ohashi Bridge. It proceeds in the southwest direction, passing through Oyake, Ono and Daigo and reaching Rokujizo.

The road splits into two at Higechaya-oiwake on Tokaido Road, with one heading to Sanjo-ohashi Bridge; iIt proceeds in the southwest direction, passing through Oyake, Ono and Daigo and reaching Rokujizo.
sen.cmt: 分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: The road splits into two at Higechaya-oiwake on Tokaido Road, with one heading to Sanjo-ohashi Bridge; iIt proceeds in the southwest direction, passing through Oyake, Ono and Daigo and reaching Rokujizo.

sen.j: 明治時代には、前記区間と六地蔵から宇治川右岸を下り観月橋までを含めた区間が「奈良街道」と位置付けられた。
sen.e: During Meiji Period, the aforementioned section, combined with the road section from Rokujizo, running along Uji-gawa River's right bank in the downstream direction until it reaches Kangetsu-kyo Bridge, was designated Nara-Kaido Road.

During Meiji period, the aforementioned section, combined with the road section from Rokujizo, running along Uji-gawa River's right bank in the downstream direction until it reaches Kangetsu-kyo Bridge, was designated 'Nara-kaido Road.'
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: During Meiji period, the aforementioned section, combined with the road section from Rokujizo, running along Uji-gawa River's right bank in the downstream direction until it reaches Kangetsu-kyo Bridge, was designated 'Nara-kaido Road.'

sen.j: 大宅より南では直線上に新道が敷設されており、現在はこちらが「奈良街道」、旧道部が「旧奈良街道」と称される。
sen.e: Because a new road starting at Oyake has been built directly south of this road, the new road is now called Nara-Kaido Road. The former road section is called Old Nara-Kaido Road.
Because a new road starting at Oyake has been built directly south of this road, the new road is now called 'Nara-kaido Road,' and the former road section is called 'Old Nara-kaido Road.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。kaido 小文字にしました。分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: Because a new road starting at Oyake has been built directly south of this road, the new road is now called 'Nara-kaido Road,' and the former road section is called 'Old Nara-kaido Road.'

sen.j: 髭茶屋追分から小野付近までは、大坂へと向かうかつての東海道延長部（東海道五十七次）の一部でもある。
sen.e: The section from Higechaya-oiwake up to a point close to Ono is also part of the extension of the old Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi, or the 53 stages of the Tokaido Road) that leads to Osaka.
The section from Higechaya-oiwake up to a point close to Ono is also part of the extension of the old Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi, or the 53 stages of the Tokaido Road) that leads to Osaka.
The section from Higechaya-oiwake up to a point close to Ono is also part of the extension of the old Tokaido Road (Tokaido Gojusan-tsugi, or the 53 stages of the Tokaido Road) that leads to Osaka.

sen.j: 東海道は、小野付近で分岐し勧修寺、大岩街道を経て伏見へと続く。
sen.e: Tokaido Road splits at a point near Ono and passes through Kaku-ji Temple and Oiwa-Kaido Road, leading onward to Fushimi.
Tokaido Road splits at a point near Ono and passes through Kaku-ji Temple and Oiwa-kaido Road, leading onward to Fushimi.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Tokaido Road splits at a point near Ono and passes through Kaku-ji Temple and Oiwa-kaido Road, leading onward to Fushimi.

tit.j: 巨椋池東岸（六地蔵から宇治を経て大久保へ）
tit.e: Ogura-ike Pond East Bank (from Rokujizo to Okubo via Uji)
Ogura-ike Pond East Bank (from Rokujizo to Okubo via Uji)
Ogura-ike Pond East Bank (from Rokujizo to Okubo via Uji)

sen.j: 六地蔵（あるいは西の観月橋付近）から木幡、宇治を経て、宇治橋を渡り、大久保で小倉堤上を南下してきた大和街道と合流する。
sen.e: From Rokujizo (or near Kangetsu-kyo Bridge in the west), the road passes through Kohata and Uji, crosses the Uji-bashi Bridge, turns south over Ogura-zutsumi at Okubo and merges with Yamato-Kaido Road.

From Rokujizo (or near Kangetsu-kyo Bridge in the west), the road passes through Kohata and Uji, crosses the Uji-bashi Bridge, turns south over Ogura-zutsumi at Okubo and merges with Yamato-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: From Rokujizo (or near Kangetsu-kyo Bridge in the west), the road passes through Kohata and Uji, crosses the Uji-bashi Bridge, turns south over Ogura-zutsumi at Okubo and merges with Yamato-kaido Road.

sen.j: 明治時代には、深草から大亀谷、八科峠を経て六地蔵までの道（現在の墨染通）とあわせて、「郡山街道」の一部として位置付けられた。
sen.e: During Meiji Period, this road, along with the section from Fukakusa, passing through Okamedani and Yashina-toge Pass and onward to Rokujizo (present-day Sumizome-dori Street), was regarded part of Kooriyama-Kaido Road.

During Meiji period, this road, along with the section from Fukakusa, passing through Okamedani and Yashina-toge Pass and onward to Rokujizo (present-day Sumizome-dori Street), was regarded part of 'Koriyama-kaido Road.'
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。Koriyama-kaido Roadに訂正しました。
sen.e: During Meiji period, this road, along with the section from Fukakusa, passing through Okamedani and Yashina-toge Pass and onward to Rokujizo (present-day Sumizome-dori Street), was regarded part of 'Koriyama-kaido Road.'

sen.j: 現在は、郡山街道と呼ばれることは無く、奈良へ通じる街道として「奈良街道」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Today, it is no longer called Kooriyama-Kaido Road but Nara-Kaido Road as the route to Nara.
Today, it is no longer called Koriyama-kaido Road but 'Nara-kaido Road' as the route to Nara.
Today, it is no longer called Koriyama-kaido Road but 'Nara-kaido Road' as the route to Nara.

sen.j: 六地蔵・宇治間では山側に新道が敷設されている。
sen.e: A new road has been built between Rokujizo and Uji, close to the mountain side.
A new road has been built between Rokujizo and Uji, close to the mountain side.
A new road has been built between Rokujizo and Uji, close to the mountain side.

tit.e: National Route 24
National Route 24
National Route 24

sen.j: 近年では、京都と奈良をつなぐ国道24号に奈良街道という愛称が付されている。
sen.e: National Route 24 is known as Nara-Kaido Road in recent years, as a road connecting Kyoto and Nara.
National Route 24 is known as Nara-kaido Road in recent years, as a road connecting Kyoto and Nara.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: National Route 24 is known as Nara-kaido Road in recent years, as a road connecting Kyoto and Nara.

tit.e: Yamato-Kaido Road
Yamato-kaido Road
tit.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
tit.e: Yamato-kaido Road

sen.j: 大阪から奈良に至る街道。
sen.e: Road from Osaka to Nara
Road from Osaka to Nara
Road from Osaka to Nara

tit.e: Tatsutagoe
Tatsutagoe
Tatsutagoe

sen.j: 広義ではいくつかのルートが存在するが、いずれも「龍田」（現在の斑鳩町龍田、龍田神社付近）を経由する。
sen.e: A number of routes exist in this section, if defined broadly. However, all of these pass through Tatsuta (presently, a point close to Tatsuta-jinja Shrine, Tatsuta, Ikaruga-cho).
A number of routes exist in this section if defined broadly, however, all of these pass through Tatsuta (presently, a point close to Tatsuta-jinja Shrine, Tatsuta, Ikaruga-cho).
sen.cmt: 分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。不要なコンマを削除しました。
sen.e: A number of routes exist in this section if defined broadly, however, all of these pass through Tatsuta (presently, a point close to Tatsuta-jinja Shrine, Tatsuta, Ikaruga-cho).

sen.j: 竜田越奈良街道 - 略称：「竜田越」。
sen.e: The name Tatsutagoe-Nara-Kaido Road is shortened and called Tatsutagoe.
The name Tatsutagoe-Nara-kaido Road is shortened and called 'Tatsutagoe.'
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: The name Tatsutagoe-Nara-kaido Road is shortened and called 'Tatsutagoe.'

sen.j: 大和川右岸に沿って通る。
sen.e: The road passes along the right bank of Yamato River.
The road passes along the right bank of Yamato-gawa River.
The road passes along the right bank of Yamato-gawa River.

sen.j: 現在の国道25号に相当する。
sen.e: Road equivalent to present-day National Route 25.
Road equivalent to present-day National Route 25.
Road equivalent to present-day National Route 25.

sen.j: 三郷町の龍田大社付近を通るが、付近にあるとされる「竜田山」を越えるからついた名称とされる。
sen.e: The name derives from the claim that the road crossed over Tatsuta-yama Mountain. The road actually passes nearby Tatsuta-taisha Shrine in Sango-cho.
The name derives from the claim that the road crossed over Tatsuta-yama Mountain; the road actually passes nearby Tatsuta-taisha Shrine in Sango-cho.
sen.cmt: 分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: The name derives from the claim that the road crossed over Tatsuta-yama Mountain; the road actually passes nearby Tatsuta-taisha Shrine in Sango-cho.

sen.j: 竜田山は龍田大社の西、信貴山の南にあたる山地とされるが現在は竜田山という名称の山は地図には残っていない。
sen.e: Tatsuta-yama Mountain is believed to be a mountainous region located west of Tatsuta-taisha Shrine and south of Mt. Shigi. However, there is no mountain by that name on the map.
Tatsuta-yama Mountain is believed to be a mountainous region located west of Tatsuta-taisha Shrine and south of Mt. Shigi, however, there is no mountain by that name on the map.
sen.cmt: 分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: Tatsuta-yama Mountain is believed to be a mountainous region located west of Tatsuta-taisha Shrine and south of Mt. Shigi, however, there is no mountain by that name on the map.

sen.j: 河内国・大和国境付近にいくつかのルートがある。
sen.e: There are a number of routes near Kawachi and Yamato provinces.
There are a number of routes near Kawachi and Yamato Provinces.
There are a number of routes near Kawachi and Yamato Provinces.

sen.j: 磐船街道・清滝街道 - 守口宿から東進、清滝峠を越え、四條畷市北田原地区で天野川 (大阪府)、竜田川沿いを南下し、龍田で竜田越に合流するルート。
sen.e: Iwafune Road and Kiyotaki-Kaido Road: A route starting at Moriguchi-shuku proceeds eastward, passing through Kiyotaki-toge Pass, turning south at Kitatahara area, Shijonawate City, running alongside Amano-gawa-River (Osaka Prefecture) and Tatsuta-gawa River and merging with Tatsutagoe at Tatsuta.

Iwafune Road and Kiyotaki-kaido Road: A route starting at Moriguchi-shuku proceeds eastward, passing through Kiyotaki-toge Pass, turning south at Kitatahara area, Shijonawate City, running alongside Amano-gawa River (Osaka Prefecture) and Tatsuta-gawa River and merging with Tatsutagoe at Tatsuta.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。不要なハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: Iwafune Road and Kiyotaki-kaido Road: A route starting at Moriguchi-shuku proceeds eastward, passing through Kiyotaki-toge Pass, turning south at Kitatahara area, Shijonawate City, running alongside Amano-gawa River (Osaka Prefecture) and Tatsuta-gawa River and merging with Tatsutagoe at Tatsuta.

sen.j: 現在の国道163号に相当する。
sen.e: It is equivalent to the present-day National Route 163.
It is equivalent to the present-day National Route 163.
It is equivalent to the present-day National Route 163.

sen.j: 俊徳街道・十三街道 - 八尾市・平群町の「十三峠」を越えて、竜田川沿いを南下し、龍田で竜田越に合流するルート。
sen.e: Shuntoku-Kaido Road and Jusan-Kaido Road: Route crossing through Jusan-toge Pass in Heguri-cho, Yao City, proceeding southward along Tatsuta-gawa River and merging with Tatsutagoe at Tatsuta.
Shuntoku-kaido Road and Jusan-kaido Road: Route crossing through Jusan-toge Pass in Heguri-cho, Yao City, proceeding southward along Tatsuta-gawa River and merging with Tatsutagoe at Tatsuta.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Shuntoku-kaido Road and Jusan-kaido Road: Route crossing through Jusan-toge Pass in Heguri-cho, Yao City, proceeding southward along Tatsuta-gawa River and merging with Tatsutagoe at Tatsuta.

sen.j: 立石街道・おおと越 - 八尾市・平群町を経由する。
sen.e: Tateishi-kaido Road and Otogoe: Route via Heguri-cho, Yao City.
Tateishi-kaido Road and Otogoe: Route via Heguri-cho, Yao City.
Tateishi-kaido Road and Otogoe: Route via Heguri-cho, Yao City.

sen.j: 平群町で十三街道・清滝街道に合流する。
sen.e: It merges with Jusan-Kaido and Kiyotaki-Kaido roads at Heguri-cho.
It merges with Jusan-kaido and Kiyotaki-kaido Roads at Heguri-cho.

sen.e: It merges with Jusan-kaido and Kiyotaki-kaido Roads at Heguri-cho.

tit.e: Igagoe
Igagoe
Igagoe

sen.j: 奈良から大和街道・伊賀街道を通り、伊賀国を経由して伊勢市に通じる道。
sen.e: Route through Yamato-Kaido Road and Iga-Kaido Road from Nara, passing through Iga Province and reaching Ise City.
Route through Yamato-kaido Road and Iga-kaido Road from Nara, passing through Iga Province and reaching Ise City.
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Route through Yamato-kaido Road and Iga-kaido Road from Nara, passing through Iga Province and reaching Ise City.

sen.j: かつては「伊賀越えならみち」「奈良道」と言った。
sen.e: It was known as Igagoe Nara-michi Road or Nara-michi Road in the past.
It was known as 'Igagoe Nara-michi Road' or 'Nara-michi Road' in the past.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。
sen.e: It was known as 'Igagoe Nara-michi Road' or 'Nara-michi Road' in the past.

sen.j: 現在では、五百野（津市美里町）で伊賀街道と分岐し、久居城下を経て月本追分（松阪市中林町）で伊勢街道と合流する区間が「奈良街道」と称される。
sen.e: Today, it splits with Iga-Kaido Road at Iono (Misato-cho, Ise City), passes through Hisaijoka and merges with Ise-Kaido Road at
